intro: Tocoyena mollis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Tocoyena mollis is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
